item.title: Shake house, 13th January
item.description:
I’m writing to raise a concern regarding recent work that was done on the road outside my house. Since that work was completed, I’ve noticed that my house has started to shake whenever heavy vehicles pass by, especially during the night. This is becoming increasingly worrying, as I have now observed several cracks appearing on the walls cracks that were not there before. Given that this issue did not exist prior to the roadwork, I would like to know if something can be done to resolve the ongoing shaking. Thank you very much for your attention. I look forward to your response.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Across from 12 Lambs Conduit Passage, 13th January
item.description:
Dear Darren, Thank you for your note back when. The lights on Lambs Conduit Passage are still out, in particular the 4 below the first tree and the 4 below the second tree. The third tree lights are working. These trees are across from 12 Lambs Conduit Passage WC1R 4RH Thank you. Stephen Herron
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Lamb's Conduit Street, Holborn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak which is flooding pavement, 13th January
item.description:
There is a water leak coming from the entrance/exit to the building works next to Elephant and Castle train station. Has been like it for at least 4-5 days. Not reported on here and doesn’t look like any effort being made to repair it. Will cause a significant slip hazard of the weather gets cold again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, Elephant Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags constantly left in communal pathway, 13th January
item.description:
Nearly every week for some time now someone from one of the block of units between #157-171 and #171-183 is leaving black rubbish bags on the ground by the end wall of these units that meets the pathway outside #62-#66; immediate neighbours have witnessed and reported the same. The most recent incident was on 12 Jan between 21:32 and 21:48 where 2 people dressed in dark clothing were seen quickly walking away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish littered all up the road., 13th January
item.description:
This seems to happen after every bin day. Residents of Wickham lane leaving wastage outside their properties over night and the foxes have their way with the rubbish. I completely get why, but the bin men do not clean the pavement / foot paths. So it often leaves rubbish along the road for days and sometimes weeks. I’m not sure when the street cleaners are meant to come but I rarely see them on Wickham Lane.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household waste dumped / bed frame / suitcase, 13th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
